intro: Dischistocalyx strobilinus, commonly known as the mountain hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, often in moist, shaded environments. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and have a rough texture, while its stems are woody and often branched. The flowers bloom in clusters and are pollinated primarily by insects, contributing to its ecological significance in its native habitat.
